title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 October 2016 - XWiki
content:
<daemoen> what is it that causes 7.0.54 to no longer be a viable tomcat base for XWiki ?  given that 7.0.54 is the version available in the repos for all of the EL varieties, id think it would be a version of tomcat that would be aimed at for support  
03:12 <jonesmeier> has quit  
03:14 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <barretto> has quit  
09:54 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <martinus\_\_> Hi there, is it possible to customize the messages returned by XWikiLogin at login time ? (like "invalid credentials") ?  
10:54 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: depends what you mean by customize, if you are talking about a custom authenticator providing a different message test, not right now but what is diplayed is a translation string associated to key "invalidcredentials" so you could change the translation text  
10:54 <tmortagne> s/test/text/  
10:56 <tmortagne> to change a translation the simplest is usually to do http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Localization+Module#HRegisterawikitranslation  
10:57 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, I'm talking of the regular ldap authenticator  
10:58 <tmortagne> ldap authenticator does not control the message either, invalid credentials is just what is displayed when the authentication failed for any reason basically  
10:59 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, that's what I guess'd ;)  
10:59 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, thanks !  
11:50 <brom> has quit  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I don't know why 8.4-rc-1, that I have just created, is not listed there: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/  
12:18 <gdelhumeau> (hi :))  
12:31 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: how have you created it? do you have the link to it?  
12:31 <vmassol> (in a meeting )  
12:32 <vmassol> ok found it http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/Data/XWiki/8.4RC1  
12:32 <gdelhumeau> with the form  
12:32 <vmassol> weird  
12:32 <vmassol> it has the correct xobject  
12:32 <gdelhumeau> I just tipped the name 8.4-rc-1  
12:32 <vmassol> I'll debug after the meeting  
12:32 <vmassol> ok?  
12:32 <gdelhumeau> maybe because it has no release date?  
12:32 <vmassol> no that's fine  
12:32 <gdelhumeau> I'm ok  
12:33 <vmassol> the same is true for 8.3  
12:33 <vmassol> (no release date)  
12:35 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: apparenrtly I have a bug when the date is empty (as you said)  
12:35 <vmassol> I've added a date and it's showing now  
12:35 <vmassol> I'll debug after

15:28 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: should be fixed now  
15:28 <vmassol> thanks for reporting

15:28 <vmassol> (I've also fixed RN-15)  
15:29 <vmassol> btw you forgot the category, maybe I should make it mandatory  
15:33 <barretto> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <vmassol> hi  
15:50 <vmassol> I'm creating a new category on jira.xwiki.org for recommended apps  
15:51 <vmassol> This will allow to have filters to list  issues related to recommended apps  
15:51 <vmassol> evalica: I'm sure you'll like this too, right?`  
15:51 <vmassol> :)  
15:53 <evalica> vmassol :) in theory yes :) but again, I'm still not 100% sure I know what recommended means  
15:53 <evalica> or should be  
15:53 <vmassol> that's easy from xwiki.org pov  
15:53 <evalica> but great! we need a filter for them  
15:53 <vmassol> it's what is on exo in the recommneded  
15:54 <vmassol> list  
15:54 <vmassol> hmm I'm still wondering though  
15:54 <vmassol> because my need is also to include some others that are not currently recommeded so I may want to create a filter  
15:54 <vmassol> but it wouldn't harm  
15:54 <vmassol> but I could hae those + add some in my own filter  
15:55 <vmassol> \*have  
15:55 <vmassol> that would be a first sort  
15:55 <vmassol> ok forget it, it doesn't match my needright now  
15:55 <vmassol> :)  
15:55 <evalica> :)
